p: It is suggested that HEV RNA detection always coincides with or follows an ALT increase. Solid organ transplant recipients having chronic HEV infection usually have high levels of liver enzymes and bilirubin [ 99]. HEV RNA can be detected not only in the serum but also in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Additionally, the viral sequences found in the CSF are reported as clearly distinct from sequences found in the serum [ 100]. Chronic infection is associated with greater heterogeneity of HEV quasispecies in transplant recipients as compared to patients with resolving infections [ 20].
